s-1.ptxt: INSTALL WINDSHIELD GLASS SPACER

s2.ptxt: Apply Primer G to the glass where the spacers will be installed.

item.ptxt: Allow the primer to dry for 3 minutes or more.
Throw away any leftover primer.
Do not apply too much primer.

s2.ptxt: Install 2 new spacers onto the glass as shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 1 WINDSHIELD GLASS STOPPER

s2.ptxt: Install 2 new stoppers to the vehicle body as shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL WINDOW GLASS ADHESIVE DAM

s2.ptxt: Apply Primer G to the glass where the glass adhesive dams will be installed.

item.ptxt: Allow the primer to dry for 3 minutes or more.
Throw away any leftover primer.
Do not apply too much primer.

s2.ptxt: Remove the peeling paper from the adhesive part of the dam. Install the dam (adhesive side) to the glass (Primer G area), but exclude the spacer area A as shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL WINDSHIELD GLASS

s2.ptxt: Position the glass.

s3.ptxt: Using suction cups, place the glass in the correct position.
Check that the entire contact surface of the glass rim is perfectly even.
Place matchmarks on the glass and vehicle body on the locations indicated in the illustration.

item.ptxt: Placing matchmarks is only necessary when installing new glass. If it is the reused glass, matchmarks should already be present.
When reusing the glass, check and correct the matchmark positions.

atten3.ptxt: Check that the stoppers are attached to the vehicle body correctly.

s3.ptxt: Using suction cups, remove the glass.

s2.ptxt: Using a brush, apply Primer M to the exposed part of the vehicle body.

item.ptxt: Allow the primer to dry for 3 minutes or more.
Do not apply primer to the adhesive.
Throw away any leftover primer.
Do not apply too much primer.

s2.ptxt: Using a brush or sponge, apply Primer G to the contact surface of the glass.

atten4.ptxt: If primer is applied to an area that is not specified, apply white gasoline to a clean cloth and wipe off the excess primer.

item.ptxt: Allow the primer to dry for 3 minutes or more.
Throw away any leftover primer.
Do not apply too much primer.

s2.ptxt: Apply adhesive to the glass.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Windshield Glass Adhesive or Equivalent

s3.ptxt: Cut off the tip of the cartridge nozzle as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: After cutting off the tip, use all adhesive within the time written in the table below.

s3.ptxt: Load the sealer gun with the cartridge.
Apply adhesive to the glass as shown in the illustration.

s2.ptxt: Install the glass to the vehicle body.

s3.ptxt: Using suction cups, position the glass so that the matchmarks are aligned. Press it in gently along the rim.
Lightly press the outer surface of the glass to ensure that it is securely fit to the vehicle body.

item.ptxt: Check that the stoppers are attached to the vehicle body correctly.
Check that the vehicle body and glass have a small gap between them.

s3.ptxt: Hold the glass in place securely with protective tape or equivalent until the adhesive hardens.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL WINDSHIELD MOULDING OUTSIDE

s2.ptxt: Using a brush or sponge, apply Primer G to the glass where a new moulding will be installed.

item.ptxt: Allow the primer to dry for 3 minutes or more.
Throw away any leftover primer.
Do not apply too much primer.

s2.ptxt: Align the moulding's marks with glass notches and install the moulding before the adhesive dries.

atten3.ptxt: Do not drive the vehicle for the amount of time written in the table below.

entry.ptxt: Minimum time prior to driving vehicle

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT FENDER TO COWL SIDE SEAL LH
INSTALL FRONT FENDER TO COWL SIDE SEAL RH
INSTALL COWL TOP VENTILATOR LOUVER LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 6 claws and 5 guides to install the cowl top ventilator louver LH.
Install the clip.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL COWL TOP VENTILATOR LOUVER RH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 4 claws and 5 guides to install the cowl top ventilator louver RH.
Install the clip.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL HOOD TO COWL TOP SEAL

s2.ptxt: Attach the 9 clips to install the seal.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Operate the wiper and stop the front wiper motor and link at the automatic stop position.
Clean the wiper arm serrations.
When reusing the front wiper motor and link assembly:

s3.ptxt: Clean the wiper pivot serrations with a wire brush.

s2.ptxt: Position the blade tip within the range shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: The blade position is indicated by the mark on the glass.

s2.ptxt: Install the front wiper arm and blade assembly LH with the nut.

atten4.ptxt: Hold the arm hinge by hand when tightening the nut.

s2.ptxt: Operate the front wipers while spraying washer fluid on the windshield glass. Make sure that the front wipers function properly and the wipers do not come into contact with the vehicle body.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY RH

s2.ptxt: Operate the wiper and stop the front wiper motor and link at the automatic stop position.
Clean the wiper arm serrations.
When reusing the front wiper motor and link assembly:

s3.ptxt: Clean the wiper pivot serrations with a wire brush.

s2.ptxt: Position the blade tip within the range shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: The blade position is indicated by the mark on the glass.

s2.ptxt: Install the front wiper arm and blade assembly RH with the nut.

atten4.ptxt: Hold the arm hinge by hand when tightening the nut.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT WIPER ARM HEAD CAP
INSTALL ROOF HEADLINING ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place the roof headlining into the vehicle as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the roof headlining when placing it.

s2.ptxt: Attach the 4 fasteners to install the roof headlining.
Install the 8 clips.
Connect the connectors and attach the 5 clamps to the front pillar.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL ASSIST GRIP

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure for all assist grips.

s2.ptxt: Install the assist grip with the 2 screws.
Attach the 4 claws and close the 2 covers.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL VISOR HOLDER LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 2 claws to install the visor holder.
Install the screw.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL VISOR HOLDER RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL VISOR ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Install the visor with the 2 screws.
Attach the guide.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL VISOR ASSEMBLY RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL MAP LIGHT ASSEMBLY (w/ Map Light)

s2.ptxt: Connect the connector.
Attach the 2 guides and claw.
Install the 2 screws to install the map light assembly.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT PILLAR GARNISH LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 3 clips to install the front pillar garnish.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT PILLAR GARNISH RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT PILLAR GARNISH LOWER LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 3 claws and 3 guides to install the lower front pillar garnish.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT PILLAR GARNISH LOWER RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR OPENING TRIM LH
INSTALL FRONT DOOR OPENING TRIM RH
INSTALL INNER REAR VIEW MIRROR ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the mirror in the direction of the white arrow.
Install the cover as shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: CHECK FOR LEAKS AND REPAIR

s2.ptxt: Conduct a leak test after the adhesive has completely hardened.
Seal any leaks with auto glass sealer.

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT CABLE TO NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL
PERFORM INITIALIZATION

s2.ptxt: Perform initialization (See page ).

atten3.ptxt: Certain systems need to be initialized after disconnecting and reconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.
